result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick Dale Rockman in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Derrick Dale Rockman. Information received.  Waive reading.  NG plea entered.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing Bail/Bond Hearing, 7-25-22
1:52 Defense argues bond motion.  Response by Sate.  Court denies motion.  Present bond cont'd.

1:26 PM Attorney Amy Pautzke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Derrick Dale Rockman. Defendant Derrick Dale Rockman in court, in custody. State calls Chief Breitenbach who is sworn & testifies.  Cross exam by Defense.  Redirect by State. Recross by Defense.   Argument by Defense.  VWC makes a statement on behalf of Victim.  Probable cause found after preliminary hearing. Defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd.
Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
